comments.text:
Testing with a beta version of IPA Mincho today, I wasn't able to get IVS variations to display correctly, either in 4.0 or using the latest nightly.

Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10.5; rv:6.0a1) Gecko/20110515 Firefox/6.0a1

Steps:

1. Install IPA Mincho beta (which contains IVS mappings and glyphs)
http://ossipedia.ipa.go.jp/ipamjfont/#LicenseEng
Note: click on the button at the bottom of the page to agree, then click on the download link

2. Click on test URL above

Result:
The same default character shows for all spokes.

Expected result:
Other variations show up along some of the spokes (compare to Windows 7 rendering which displays correctly).

comments.text:
Mac OS X 10.5 doesn't support glyph selection by IVS. It just ignore the unsupported default ignorable code points (including IVS).
Of course we can add a special handling for 10.5 as I did for WinXP.

comments.text:
(In reply to comment #5)
> Mac OS X 10.5 doesn't support glyph selection by IVS. It just ignore the
> unsupported default ignorable code points (including IVS).

This would be the explanation if we're using Core Text, but AFAIK the text should be getting rendered via Harfbuzz. In that case, we have code that should support IVS glyph selection regardless of the platform.
